description.1: In a pan add the Chocolate and butter and heat in a water bath until you obtain a homogeneous cream.
description.2: Add brown sugar and sugar and stir until well dissolved.
description.3: In a container, beat the eggs with the vanilla essence and mix with the chocolate cream.
description.4: Add the wheat flour, yeast and nuts.
description.5: Pour the dough into a rectangular shape pan, greased with butter and sprinkled with wheat flour and place in a preheated medium oven (180°C) for around 20 minutes.
description.6: Unmold and let it cool. Cut in squares and serve.

description.1: Chop the potatoes and carrot into cubes and cook in the pressure cooker for 15 minutes. Then put it to drain, set aside.
description.2: Chop the chicken breast into large cubes, add the garlics and cook in the pressure cooker with 2 cups of water or enough water to cover the chicken.
description.3: Purée chicken, potatoes, carrot and collard greens with a blender
description.4: Return it to a pan and boil for two minutes
description.5: You can add other spices as you wish.

imageAlt: Green Soup in a Plate Image

description.1: Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4 and line two baking sheets with parchment.
description.2: Cream the butter (melted) and sugars together until very light and fluffy, then beat in the egg and vanilla. Once combined, stir in the flour, bicarb, chocolate and ¼ tsp salt.
description.3: Scoop 10 large tbsps of the mixture onto the trays, leaving enough space between each to allow for spreading.
description.4: Bake for 10-12 mins or until firm at the edges but still soft in the middle – they will harden a little as they cool.
description.5: Leave to cool on the tray for a few mins before eating warm, or transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. .

description.1: Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
description.2: Add the garlic and 3 green onions and cook for 2–3 minutes, until fragrant and tender.
description.3: Add the carrots and snap peas, then stir in the brown sugar and soy sauce.
description.4: Add the noodles (cooked and dried) and toss for a couple of minutes, until the noodles are well-coated and the vegetables are tender. Season with salt and pepper.
description.5: Serve immediately, garnished with the remaining green onion.

description.1: In a large pot on medium-high heat, gently bring the milk to a simmer over medium heat.
description.2: Add the macaroni and cook until tender. Remove the pot from the heat.
description.3: Add the butter (unsalted ), cheddar, salt, and pepper to the noodles and stir until the cheese and butter melt into the milk to create a thick sauce that coats the noodles.

description.1: In a saucepan over medium-high heat, add the coconut milk, sugar, salt, and cinnamon sticks.
description.2: Use the hand mixer to mix until the sugar and salt dissolve and let the mixture boil slightly.
description.3: While you wait for the coconut milk to boil, add the cornstarch and water to a cup or glass with a lid and stir or whisk well until all the cornstarch dissolves and there are no lumps. It should be like a watery milkshake.
description.4: When the coconut milk starts to boil, remove the cinnamon sticks. Then, lower the heat.
description.5: Add the cornstarch water shake, beating constantly. Continue beating until form a thick cream but still liquid.
description.6: Remove from heat and immediately add to your favorite mold(s). Use the flexible spatula to remove the liquid.
description.7: Let the mixture cool to room temperature until you can comfortably touch the mold. Then, refrigerate the mixture for 3 hours.
description.8: To serve, flip the tembleque onto a serving plate.

description.1: Heat 2 tablespoons of sesame oil in a large, high-walled skillet over medium heat. Add the Spiral-Cut Ham and fry until warmed through and browned, about 3–4 minutes. Transfer the ham to a medium bowl and set aside.
description.2: Add another 2 tablespoons of sesame oil to the pan, then add the beaten eggs. Cook, stirring, for 1–2 minutes, until the eggs are soft-scrambled. Add to the bowl with the ham and set aside.
description.3: Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of sesame oil to the pan, then add all but 2 tablespoons of the green onions, the snap peas, and the carrot. And cook for 4–5 minutes, until the vegetables are just tender. Remove the pan from the heat.
description.4: Add the rice, ham, and egg to the pan with the vegetables and stir to combine. Add the soy sauce and stir to evenly distribute.
description.5: Serve the fried rice topped with the cilantro, sesame seeds, reserved green onions, and Sriracha, if desired.

description.1: In a mixing bowl, beat eggs. Gradually add sugar. While beating slowly pour in oil. Add vanilla.
description.3: Add dry ingredients alternately with sour cream to the egg mixture.
description.5: Spoon into the greased muffin tin or paper liners
